Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Better Software!
Reviews.Author: CrazyDays
Reviews.Content: Best camera that I've purchased.NOT HD quality - 640x400Night-vision works well.  HomeMonitor software is AWESOME!  For each movement, it rewinds the recording so you "see it coming".HomeMonitor saves your movement recordings for 7 days for FREE - what a great service.Works very well with our iPhone Apps.Can hear and watch movement video recordings or live on App or on website.I'm buying another!

Reviews.Title: Okay at first, but not now
Reviews.Author: T. Leamon
Reviews.Content: I had no problem setting up the camera.  Accessing the camera from my laptop, desktop and Samsung Galaxy 3S was easy.  I got notifications every time lightning even flashed momentarily.  After less than 1 month though everything went to hell.  First the camera became stuck in black-and-white mode.  Then when accessing the archive from my desktop I could only get sound and not video (oddly enough everything seemed fine when accessing from my laptop and phone).  Then when I tried to access live view I repeatedly got a notice that the camera was busy...try back in a few minutes.  Then I got notices that the camera was not connected.I tried resetting the camera and router from the ground up and everything seemed to work again...live view...video recording...color...for about an hour.  Once again everything turned to crap.  Be prepared for frustration with this one in the long term.  Customer support is only minimally helpful and it takes them a day to respond to an email.  I'm not sure if the problems are with their hardware, software, or access through their web site, but there are definite problems.UPDATE!!!!  UPDATE!!!!  UPDATE!!!!I finally got the camera to work, but only after deleting everything and re-installing the camera.  Everything has worked without a hitch for several weeks except for a problem that their customer support has been unable to resolve. Since they are in the UK the time difference is a great hindrance to prompt solutions.  When accessing archived video on my computer I could hear the audio, but got no video.  The problem did not occur when accessing archived video from my phone.  Their solution was to update Flash or to try Chrome as my browser instead of IE 10.  THANKS!  After installing Chrome I now cannot find the camera in archived video OR live mode.  Everything has gone from bad to worse.  I have no problems with playing any other videos on any site except Home Monitor's site.  Once again, I apparently will have to re-install the camera, but I'm not sure now if even that will work.  I cannot recommend this camera!  Their customer support tries, but they have been completely ineffective in resolving my problems.

Reviews.Title: love the features, just wished it worked consistently
Reviews.Author: bjackiec7
Reviews.Content: this camera is the only one I could find that would upload directly to the cloud which is awesome. the problem is, and I have 2, is that if the internet goes out (I have TWC so it goes out once a month), the camera needs to be reset from scratch. that is in itself annoying, but when it's mounted in a corner of your ceiling and you need to get ladder, Ethernet cable, etc, it takes about 45 mins to an hour so it's REALLY REALLY annoying!! Customer service is terrible too, they respond quickly (within 24 hours) but to get one of items returned because the wireless antenna went out, it literally took months of back and forth emails before I was finally able to switch it out. seemed like a battle of wills where they figured I'd get so annoyed that I'd give up!

Reviews.Title: EASY SET UP
Reviews.Author: Charles Roth II
Reviews.Content: WORKS ON LAP TOP AND SMART PHONE AND IS EASY TO REPROGRAM. HAVE HAD NO TROUBLES EVEN WHEN THE WEATHER HAS BEEN VERY COLD.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: david moore
Reviews.Content: easy set-up works just like they say. only problem i had was the cat was setting it off so i changed the setting

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive security
Reviews.Author: downeaster
Reviews.Content: We have a remote summer camp in area prone to seasonal break ins. The Y-cam has all the right feature to monitor our premises, plus we can  see what the dogs have been up to when we leave them while shopping for supplies.

Reviews.Title: It just works! Easy and good quality. Great support as well!
Reviews.Author: Nuno Dias
Reviews.Content: I have already bought my second camera. Very good experience. Would like having the chance to record to an SD card in parallel though. Customer support is very professional, and will really try to help. Overall I'm very happy and would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great little units
Reviews.Author: G C MUTTON
Reviews.Content: Great little units (I have 3). Tech support at Y-Cam were very helpful when I had an issue with the first install but after that it was a very easy job to set the other two up.Both the desk top (Windows 7), Android (Samsung S3 & 4) and Apple touch apps work well and to date with very few issues. Online recordings work well and I've had no issues downloading the clips I wished to keep.Picture quality? Day time colour output is surprisingly good as is the night-time black and white. OK not broadcast quality but for the price/package its very good. The IR emitters work well at night but forget about using the indoor camera looking out of a window. If you have the IR emitters switched on and the camera close to the glass there is a lot of back glare. You can select for the IR's to be turned off so an external IR lamp could be used to provide night illumination. As with all things, the right tool for the job is a good idea which is probably why Y-Cam sell an outdoor model. May be in the new year...............Would I buy from Y-Cam again and recommend them and their products to others? An emphatic, yes.

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: T. Swanson
Reviews.Content: Good image, only a few seconds delay when viewing over the internet when away from home. Night vision looks as good as daylight. Setup in living room and it uses my home wi-fi to capture movement. I log on to the free account and can view it live or see recorded movement on any recent date. Recording movement can be adjusted for portion of viewing window, time of day and big or small movements (ignore pets). Had a bit of difficulty setting up the wireless automatically, but when I entered the info manually, good to go. I e-mailed tech support and they were very prompt and helpful even re-writing the FAQ section to cover changing the wi-fi password which is what I was trying to do. I would recommend again and again.

Reviews.Title: Its works!
Reviews.Author: Retro Shopper
Reviews.Content: So far it works great, as promised, I'll try it out on my next trip to Europe with the motion sensor. See if it notifies me there.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: janet snyder
Reviews.Content: It is so great to check up my furry friends while I am at work ! The picture quality is great . Convenient from my phone or computer at work .

Reviews.Title: can't get better than free
Reviews.Author: Timothy Wayne Michalk
Reviews.Content: Get this when on sale, then it's a really good deal. Plus with the free week of monitoring, u can hardly beet it especially when the others want so much n charge a arm n leg for just minimal monitoring.

Reviews.Title: Homemonitor, What a blast
Reviews.Author: gary
Reviews.Content: The  Homemonitor was easy to  set-up  and  I am  having  a wonderful  time  using the  camera and the  apps. Now  I am sure  the  house  is  secure  when no  one  is  at  home  and  I  can see  my  Kids  when they  get  back  from  school. I can  access the  liveview and get  a  push-notification  when there  is  motion. The  best  thing  of all  is  that  unlike  all  the  other  cameras  that I  have before  now, I  havent  gone  over  my  monthly  limit  on  my  Broadband. lol Thanks  Y-cam

Reviews.Title: Must have got a bad one
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: The initial setup went OK, but things just kept getting worse. I had the camera up and running and in the middle of the night I tried to get it to record me entering the room. The light was on green and I had the motion detection on. It didn't record anything and I was in the room at least 10 seconds. not a good start.I tried updating the firmware to see if that would help. It would not update via WiFi (tried 3 times). I disconnected the camera and tried to update with the ethernet cable, that workedthen I put the camera back where it was and the headache began. it did not connect. I reset the camera, deleted the entire setup profile online and started overThe setup page kept giving me trouble then. I was constantly being logged off the site for no reason, and everything was giving errors. At this point any impatient person would be ready to return the unit... but I'm pretty patientAfter about an hour the setup process finished, but the motion detection zones image never loaded (it didn't before I updated the firmware either), but I thought it was no big deal at the timeContacted tech support and they didn't seem to understand what I was asking. Long story short I figured it out myself. The motion detection zones are in JavaScript, and I didn't have that installed. Nothing on their webpage mentions that part is JavaStill not working right after that though. the camera simply didn't record anything when I entered the room in the middle of night (what if someone broke in?!!?)Then last night I tried turning the sensitivity up. There is a bar that you can adjust between small movement and large movement. I adjusted it about 1/3 of the way up, from 2/3 which is the factory setting. I also had motion detection zones setup so there shouldn't be false alarmsso I tried again and went down by the camera in the middle of the night, trying to get it to record me. I noticed the green light blinking and thought SWEET, it must be working now right?!!?when I woke up I noticed at first my internet connection said it sent/ received 2.6GB overnight (not good because I have a download limit too)I went to check the video recorded and there was nothing. where did all this data go?!?! I seriously think the firmware update screwed up my camera and now all the settings are going to nowhere because its just not working right.considering sending this camera back :(Update: sent the camera back. got the Sharx VIPcella SCNC2700 instead. guess what works fine :)even before updating the firmware on the Y-CAM I wasn't very impressed with it. the FPS are low (Y-CAM doesn't even list the specs on this camera) and overall just slow response. I would recommend the Sharx one instead. its not as easy to setup, but its worth it.If you are considering the HomeMonitor I would NOT recommend it for security purposes anyway. even when working correctly it seems to miss recording things way too much

Reviews.Title: Flakey product
Reviews.Author: Leonardo A. Linhares "Leolinhares"
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box started having problems. Following instructions line by line, issues with the wifi and holding the configuration. Sometimes you could see the "live view" online or with an app, and sometimes you can't. If you need this to be a reliable camera (i.e. security or viewing who is at your door), then perhaps this is not the right product for you (or me.) Everything I with this particular product would work some of the time (correctly setup) and others it would not work at all. I sent an email to customer support a few days ago and, yes you guessed it, no response. return ... NEXT.

Reviews.Title: Y-cam HomeMonitor Indoor - Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera with Free Online Recording
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: The video quality is fair but choppy, regardless of how you access the recording (i.e., website or smartphone app).  There were times that it did not record/post my activity in the room so I'm not confident of its reliability from a security standpoint.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up and free 7 day cloud recording and monitoring
Reviews.Author: Val K. Loh
Reviews.Content: love this camera, I had put it under a canopy for outdoor use since fall of 2013 and going through this past harsh winter and it is still working fine now.

Reviews.Title: The best camera for ease of use!
Reviews.Author: Tee
Reviews.Content: This camera was soon easy to set up! No fussing with the wifi, ip addresses, etc. No need to insert a cd or anything. The use is easy - app is free for smart devices and never crashes. Picture quality is great in light and dark. Captures movement well. I use my cameras for monitoring stairs to my second floor and my infirm mother-in-law's room. Love the free 7 day storage and motion alerts to my phone.

Reviews.Title: Y-cam indoor
Reviews.Author: Todd C
Reviews.Content: After doing some research I decided on this camera and bought one.  I had a minor issue with its operation but the technical support person was very helpful and I found that it wasn't a problem with the camera but rather how I was using it.  I bought two more a week later.  They work very well, although my DSL internet connection often isn't fast enough to utilize the app to its potential.  The picture quality and frame rate are quite good and the night vision is fantastic.  Motion detection zones are reliable as are the email alerts when any activity is captured.  This doesn't record constantly, only for the brief time anything activates the detection zone and remains active while in the zone, so most of my recorded clips are about 15-30 seconds in length.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: Brenden T.
Reviews.Content: This is a great product. Very simple to set up. The free online support was what did it for me, and has worked great. Much better than the similar products that a subscription of $20 per month per camera. He's what a joke that is compared to this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera I love it
Reviews.Author: TERRY L LONG
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to monitor my home while away. I wanted something easy and it had to meet my every day needs. Plus my wife had to be able to learn to turn the camera on and off so it had to be easy to operate. I am so glad I chose this camera. Set up was easy and connecting to internet was a breeze. Only issue I had and it’s not a deal breaker I could not see video on my internet explorer running windows 7. I do believe it was just a setting as my work computer running windows xp I could see it fine. I just switched to Google Chrome on my home computer and typed in homemonitoer.em and it came up instantly with video. Made all my necessary adjustments from there. I do love the 2 zone feature its great you can adjust these zones and there sensitivity to your liking. You can set times to record which is great only thing. I wish you could adjust them to the ½ not just the hour but once again not a deal breaker. As far as the phone I am running an old version android on my cell and its only 3g. I can pull up the screen for home monitor but can not see any video. I can turn on and off the motion and alerts from my phone as this main reason I use my phone is to turn the system on and off and it works very well. One thing I found out is when you load the homemonitor.me I have to refresh at once as long as I do that I can turn the camera on and off if not it seems to get confused but I believe that may be normal. The more than one e mail feature is great as my wife and I both get an e mail alert when a motion is detected. If we receive any e mail alerts our e mail send us a text instantly. (most cell phones you can do this on) I can see the alert in the text and pull it up on my e mail also. The picture feature in the email is a blessing, if you don’t see any thing out of place you don’t have to go any further and pull up the video. All in all I love this camera and have had no issues with it. I do recommend when you get one to give your self time about 2 or 3 weeks until you work out all the adjustment like times and zones and sensitivity to get the camera working as your liking. I am looking to buy another one in a near future to cover my work shop area.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: fd1
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the quality of the product.  I got it up and working quickly.  I have now set it up so that it comes on when I arm my alarm system away.  If it sees motion I get an email and can view recording or live what is moving in my house.  There is a delay, but I still like the product.

Reviews.Title: unreliable data storage
Reviews.Author: katie brandon
Reviews.Content: worked well for the first week.  the last 2 days it has not recorded and sent any video.  i contacted support via email and still waiting for a response.  no phone support seems sketchy.  im going to look into other companies.  feels like it was a waste of money.  reliability is key when it comes to safety and this service is not cutting it.

Reviews.Title: Great video monitoring camera
Reviews.Author: Lori Smith
Reviews.Content: This video monitoring camera is easy to set up and use.Easy to view over the internet in real time.Excellent product.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera!
Reviews.Author: M. T. Volosin
Reviews.Content: The camera was easy to set up, and it's nice having a website where the video clips are stored and can be downloaded.  I've ordered a second camera for another location.

Reviews.Title: Easy and quick install and setup with remote access
Reviews.Author: S. Terry
Reviews.Content: We were planning an extended vacation and wanted to setup a security camera that would: record to the cloud, motion sensitive and send us alerts.  This camera is SUPER easy setup and works great.  I agree the night vision could be better.  I like the fact it records to the cloud so if an intruder noticed the cam and unplugged it they would already be recorded in the cloud.  The alerts work great to email as well as to the iPhone/ipad app.  Now we have gotten used to having it and often when we leave home to run an errand we use the iPhone app to remotely enable the motion detection.  Definitely recommend this camera to those that want a quick and easy video security solution.

Reviews.Title: Very convenient
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: This camera was easy to set up. The instructions are simple and if you follow them exactly, it takes little time to get the camera operational. It meets my needs for monitoring, providing an email/notification when there is motion. The wireless connectivity is great, giving flexibility for placement with respect to your wireless router.Two regions can be specified for motion-activated recording. You only get a brief clip to review while there is motion. The frame rate is sufficient for monitoring purposes and the image quality is sufficient. It is not HD and is not high-frame rate, but for most monitoring applications it isn't necessary to have that. With free web storage of the clips, it is easy to review them from any computer through the company's website, and using an app you can download for smart devices (iPhones etc). There's a little delay between motion activated recording and notification, but again for most purposes, this is OK. Sometimes, it can take 5 minutes or so for a newly recorded clip to become available through the app or on the web. In testing, comparing the push notifications to the app, with email notifications, it does appear that not every motion that generates a notification generates an email, though all clips are available for review. For this reason, I take off one star.I considered this and the DropCam. The Dropcam costs more, but is higher definition. It will also provide cloud recording (more than just clips) at a monthly subscription of $10. I figured I didn't need that capability.If you prefer to have video stored locally, you can't set that up with this camera.Night time vision is possible, with the IR LED array, and provides decent illumination over a reasonable distance. However, as with all such devices, if you are intending to place this behind a window to monitor outside activity, glass does not transmit IR very well, so you basically get to see a reflection of the LED array in the monitor.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Charles Ibis
Reviews.Content: I have had two of these installed for a month. The new camera was easy and quick to install. The only snag on the second camera installation was caused by it being a refurnished unit (sold by Amazon Warehouse).  I had to wait an extra day to get the used camera unlocked by tech support in the UK, which is 8 hours ahead of me on the US west coast. The team was very responsive to my needs and I was up and running with the used camera in a day.I love that the online hosting is free for life. When motion is detected, an online video clip is available within a few minutes. The iPhone app is very useful in cases where I've been notified of motion outside the house when I'm not at home. There is about a 30 second lag before _live_ video appears on the app or web browser but the notification is almost immediate.Both of my cameras are mounted inside my house looking out a window. The picture quality is fine for standard def.  For example, I can recognize the gardener easily. The night vision would work well if not for the reflection on the glass. In truth, I should have purchased the outdoor model for more effective night vision but I don't have outside power so that was not an option for me. The wireless network aspect is useful but keep in mind that they need AC power to operate.Overall, I think these are an excellent value and the best deal for the money. If you need high definition, you should look at some of the other brands but be prepared to pay for online video storage.

Reviews.Title: keep an eye on pets
Reviews.Author: C. Simmons
Reviews.Content: this actually has very impressive resolution when light enough, but understandably hard to see in dark.  nice to keep an eye on things when away

Reviews.Title: Worst tech support ever
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I spent $700.00 in October for cameras and they are still not online!!  I am not at home very often- that's why I bought cameras.  I try to set them up when I am home but cannot get them to work.  Emailed tech support.  They will email back in a day or two but that doesn't help because I have left for work by then.  I emailed and asked if I could please speak to someone when I am home to get these working but all I get is emailed suggestions on what to do.  I'm reasonably tech savy and this looks like it should be easy to set up.  I have three cameras that show up on the online monitor but none will work.  And they all act differently!  Very upsetting!

ProductInfo.Features:
Fast and easy setup - Get setup and watching your camera in seconds. No software installation or router setup needed.
No Subscription - 7 days free unlimited storage for all your videos stored securely in your own cloud-based online account. No monthly sign-up, ongoing payment, or subscription required.
Bandwidth friendly - Doesn't constantly use internet bandwidth like other internet-based systems as HomeMonitor only streams when you need it to.
Infrared night vision - Around the clock performance with built-in professional infrared night vision which lets you see up to 15m, even in complete darkness.
Motion detection and alerts - Record video clips and get email notifications sent directly to your device when any movement is detected.
ProductInfo.Name: Y-cam HomeMonitor Indoor - Wi-Fi Wireless Security Camera with Free Cloud Recording & Night vision
